documents.title: Vegan Breakfast Ideas
documents.content: Start your day with hearty vegan breakfasts. Overnight oats: combine rolled oats, plant milk, chia seeds, maple syrup, and vanilla; refrigerate overnight; top with fresh berries. Tofu scramble: crumble firm tofu, saut√© with turmeric, nutritional yeast, garlic, and vegetables for an egg-like texture. Banana pancakes: blend oats into flour, mix with mashed banana, plant milk, and baking powder; cook on a griddle. Smoothie bowls: blend frozen a√ßa√≠ or berries with banana and a splash of oat milk; top with granola, coconut, and fresh fruit.
documents.summary: Quick and nutritious plant-based breakfast recipes to start your morning.

documents.title: Hearty Vegan Main Dishes
documents.content: Chickpea curry: saut√© onion, garlic, and ginger; add curry powder, cumin, and turmeric; stir in chickpeas, coconut milk, and diced tomatoes; simmer 20 minutes; serve over rice. Lentil bolognese: cook lentils until tender; saut√© with marinara sauce, mushrooms, and Italian herbs; serve over pasta. Buddha bowls: arrange quinoa, roasted sweet potato, saut√©ed kale, edamame, avocado, and tahini dressing in a bowl. Stuffed bell peppers: fill with a mixture of rice, black beans, corn, tomatoes, and spices; bake at 375¬∞F for 30 minutes.
documents.summary: Satisfying plant-based dinner recipes that are filling and flavorful.

documents.title: Decadent Vegan Desserts
documents.content: Chocolate avocado mousse: blend ripe avocados, cocoa powder, maple syrup, and vanilla until silky smooth; chill before serving. Vegan brownies: use flax eggs (1 tbsp ground flax + 3 tbsp water), coconut oil, and almond flour for fudgy results. Nice cream: freeze ripe bananas, then blend until creamy; add cocoa, peanut butter, or berries for flavors. Coconut whipped cream: refrigerate full-fat coconut cream overnight; whip the solid part with powdered sugar and vanilla. Energy balls: mix dates, nuts, oats, and cocoa in a food processor; roll into balls.
documents.summary: Indulgent dairy-free and egg-free dessert recipes.

documents.title: Plant-Based Protein Sources
documents.content: Tofu (10g protein per 100g): versatile, absorbs flavors well, works in stir-fries, scrambles, and desserts. Tempeh (19g per 100g): fermented soybeans with nutty flavor, great grilled or crumbled. Seitan (25g per 100g): wheat gluten with meaty texture, ideal for sandwiches and stews. Lentils (9g per 100g cooked): quick-cooking, perfect for soups and curries. Chickpeas (7g per 100g): great roasted, in hummus, or curries. Edamame (11g per 100g): whole soybeans, excellent as snacks or in bowls. Nutritional yeast: cheesy flavor, adds B vitamins and 8g protein per 2 tablespoons.
documents.summary: High-protein plant foods and how to incorporate them into meals.

documents.title: Essential Vegan Substitutions
documents.content: Eggs: flax egg (1 tbsp flax + 3 tbsp water) for binding; aquafaba (chickpea liquid) for meringues; mashed banana for moisture. Milk: oat milk (creamy, neutral), almond milk (light), coconut milk (rich, for curries). Butter: coconut oil or vegan butter for baking. Cheese: nutritional yeast for cheesy flavor; cashew cream for ricotta; store-bought vegan cheese for melting. Honey: maple syrup or agave nectar. Cream: full-fat coconut milk. Meat: jackfruit (pulled pork texture), mushrooms (umami), cauliflower (buffalo wings), lentils (ground meat).
documents.summary: How to replace animal products in any recipe with plant-based alternatives.
